title: Manna Dey
summary: Prabodh Chandra Dey   (1 May 1919 âˆ’ 24 October 2013), known by his stage name Manna Dey, was an Indian playback singer, music director, and a musician. As a classical vocalist, he belonged to the Bhendibazaar Gharana and was trained under Ustad Aman Ali Khan.[2] He is considered one of the most versatile and celebrated vocalists of the Hindi film industry,[3][4][5] often credited with the success of Indian classical music in Hindi commercial movies.[5] As a musician, Dey is best known for infusing Indian classical music in a pop framework that ushered the golden period in Hindi cinema.[6]
